FuncDef:
The remote-download acl warning-threshold command configures the alarm threshold for the usage of classifier-behavior pairs dynamically delivered by the RADIUS server.
The undo remote-download acl warning-threshold command restores the default alarm threshold for the usage of classifier-behavior pairs dynamically delivered by the RADIUS server.
By default, an alarm is generated if the usage of classifier-behavior pairs dynamically delivered by the RADIUS server reaches 80%.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an alarm threshold.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 100. The default value is 80.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If the maximum number of classifier-behavior pairs allowed by a device have been used, the device does not process classifier-behavior pairs further delivered by the RADIUS server. To prevent this problem, run the remote-download acl warning-threshold command to configure the alarm threshold for the usage of classifier-behavior pairs so that the device can reclaim the classifier-behavior pairs not in use.
Configuration Impact
After this command is run, an alarm is generated if the usage of classifier-behavior pairs reaches the specified alarm threshold, and a clear alarm is generated if the usage of classifier-behavior pairs falls below 90% of the alarm threshold.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
